    • Field Detail

      • SOURCE

        public static final java.lang.String SOURCE
        These are Node types. They are not case-sensitive. They correspond to the type field in the nodes.txt input file. They are used to identify the Node subclass that is to be constructed.

    • Method Detail

      • createNetwork

        public Network createNetwork​(java.lang.String name)
        Reads in the network with the given directory. For instance, if given the name "2-link", it will read in the network in the "networks/2-link" folder.

      • readParams

        public void readParams​(java.io.File params)

      • createNode

        public Node createNode​(int id,
                       java.lang.String type,
                       double longitude,
                       double latitude,
                       double elevation)
        Constructs a node with the given parameters. Elevation is in ft.

      • createLink

        public Link createLink​(int id,
                       java.lang.String type,
                       Node source,
                       Node dest,
                       double length,
                       double ffspeed,
                       double capacity,
                       int numLanes)
        Constructs a link with the given parameters. Capacity is in veh/hr. Free flow speed is in mi/hr. Length is in mi.

      • readNodes

        public void readNodes​(java.io.File file)
        Reads all nodes from the specified file. Header data is ignored.

      • readLinks

        public void readLinks​(java.io.File file)
        Reads all links from the specified file. Header data is ignored.

      • readDemand

        public void readDemand​(java.io.File file)
        Reads the demand (incoming vehicles) from the given file

      • readTurningProportions

        public void readTurningProportions​(java.io.File file)
        Reads the turning proportions from the given file.

      • readSignals

        public void readSignals​(java.io.File signals,
                        java.io.File phases)
        This method reads the signal cycle data for all nodes. Note that signal cycle data will only be stored for nodes that are actual signals. Otherwise, it will be ignored. This method reads two files: first, it looks at signals.txt to calculate the offset. Then, it looks at phases.txt to read signal phases
